Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[telegram] <Regnar> Agreed if you can't liquidate it's hard to justify the run, however before these new exchanges were listing KMD, Binance had already disabled wallets, and Binance is sitting on probably the largest supply of KMD (some estimates of 10 Million KMD).
If there is that much KMD sitting on the exchange with the highest price, they could easily sell KMD for BTC, send the BTC to another exchange with lower price and Buy KMD there. A single arbitrage to pull 10% gains and get more KMD.
The reverse (selling on Binance from other wallets) doesn't work, but we could and should see one way arbitrage that shows more selling pressure in Binance and buying pressure elsewhere. (re @EPIDEMIC_media: You cant sell anywhere thats showing the best price unless you have KMD on exchange. Thats why this run is a mirage. A true run allows you to liquidate on demand)

Content:
[telegram] <Regnar> And if these exchanges that still have deposits enabled, and have lower amount of KMD available, we should see arbitrage equalize the price quickly.
It's also possible people aren't doing this because they LIKE trading the isolated prices, we shouldn't always assume the market is rational üòÖ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[telegram] <Craig> If anyone is bullish on verus I'd love to hear why.
I swear I read a fair amount, and even watched the crypto rich interview with the michael. 
but i could never figure out the relevant differences between pbaas and baas. I think there's even a project called mitx that does bpaas.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[telegram] <Vollka_Racho> There are several big thing about PBaaS:
1) no entity skimming fees: al proceeds goes to the people securing the network. No entity other than those is gaining from it (for the people, by the people)
2) (multiple) currency reserves: makes it possible to exchange your coins from the PBaaS chain to VRSC without a 3rd party buying your coins. The system is built into the blockchain itself. A 2nd reserve can in future be made to another PBaaS chain or even to a fiat on-ramp
3) Chains can be finite. If we have voting in the future, a chain can run for a pre-set period. (re @Craig: If anyone is bullish on verus I'd love to hear why.
I swear I read a fair amount, and even watched the crypto rich interview with the michael. 
but i could never figure out the relevant differences between pbaas and baas. I think there's even a project called mitx that does bpaas.)

That would be a guaranteed profit in BTC with the same amount of KMD holdings, or ending with more KMD. But it isn't happening right now.
People are FULLY acknowledging the price discrepancy due to Binance disabling deposits, but aren't narrow minded enough to think that is the sole reason for price increasing. Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[telegram] <Craig> Was the stress test a failure? Not if the devs got good data.
HOWEVER
As a casual investor and potential user I found it sobering.
I had seen people posting on Twitter and YouTube about how awesome atomDEX is. 
The crypto community is sleeping on the fact that the holy Grail of crypto aka a LEGIT dex is already here! 
Just a matter of time until people notice!
I was hyped! 
Then I tried it out. Almost unusable. I'm not talking about how it was overwhelmed by 160(!?) testers.  Problem is, there are absolutely no features at the moment, not even a public orderbook. Things I didn't even think were features, like charts, just aren't there yet.
To be clear, I dont blame the team because my favorite idiot Twitter personalities over promise. 
But here is how I felt after the test: 
"This needs probably 6 months to be ready for prime time, and probably a few months after that to start catching on. Meanwhile you have like 50 competitors trying to lauch their DEX in the same time frame. Not to mention the possibility that people just stick with central exchanges.
"KMD has been bleeding for 18, 20 months, maybe longer. I don't expect that to change before they deliver cool, speculator friendly stuff. I mean, look at what's happening in the ETH ecosystem, all their defi stuff. Derivatives, lending, oracle's, tons of stuff. In 9 months KMD will have a sweet DEX (we hope) but some of these other ecosystems might have X Y and Z by then, on top of various decentralized exchanges."
Anyway I decided to hold my KMD after the stress test, but count me skeptical on november's 500 to 1300 pump.
